adjectives.description: latitudinarian (comparative more latitudinarian, superlative most latitudinarian)

entries.meaning: Not restrained; not confined by precise limits.
Tolerant, especially of other people's religious views.
examples: ’Tis probable, that the Account here given of the Religion of the Natives of Madagascar, may, by Some, be thought a mere Fiction, and inserted with no other View, than to advance some Latitudinarian Principles  […]

entries.meaning: Lax in moral or religious principles.
A person who is tolerant of others' religious views.
